title: 106_s972
content: There is no information provided in the prev_chunk to assist with summarizing the curr_chunk. The Wild and Scenic Rivers Act is amended to designate a 23.5 mile segment of the Lamprey River in New Hampshire as a recreational river, administered by the Secretary of the Interior through cooperative agreements. The Lamprey River in New Hampshire is designated as a recreational river under the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act, to be managed according to the Lamprey River Management Plan. The Secretary of the Interior coordinates management responsibilities for the designated segment with the Lamprey River Advisory Committee, satisfying comprehensive management plan requirements under the Act. The Lamprey River Advisory Committee, established under New Hampshire RSA 483, oversees land management in Epping, Lee, Durham, and Newmarket. Zoning ordinances in these towns include provisions for conservation of shoreland, floodplains, and wetlands associated with the segment, meeting federal standards. The Lamprey River Advisory Committee oversees land management in Epping, Lee, Durham, and Newmarket, with zoning ordinances including provisions for conservation of shoreland, floodplains, and wetlands. Federal regulations prohibit Federal acquisition of lands by condemnation, limiting land acquisition to donation or with owner consent. The Lamprey River Management Plan includes additional criteria for land management. Section 405 of the Omnibus Parks and Public Lands Management Act of 1996 is repealed.
